title: Edgar_Wallace.Mind_of_Mr_JG_Reader.[2007].BBC_audio_book.ogg.rad
description:
The Mind of Mr JG Reeder

by Edgar Wallace

Read by David Horovitch

The Mind of Mr. J. G. Reeder is a short story compilation by the British crime writer Edgar Wallace published in 1925. The story has been adapted on film, television and radio. (Wikipedia).  The story is about Mr. Reeder, a police officer, who works for the Public Prosecutor&#039;s office and has "the mind of a criminal". (BBC)

Episode 1 - The Poetical Policeman: Mr JG Reeder has the mind of a criminal. His novel methods bring the criminals of 1920s London to justice.

Episode 2 - The Troupe: Mr Reeder&#039;s curiosity is aroused when a transatlantic impresario rents an out-of-season cottage. He can only be up to no good.

Episode 3 - A Princely Death: Ellis goes from being a hostage to a murder suspect. Stars Philip Madoc as Cadfael. First heard in 1995.

Episode 4 - The Strange Case: Mr Reeder gets to the truth of a wealthy government minister&#039;s death but fails to prevent a knock-on tragedy.
